items.title: Full Time: Senior Software Engineer for Digital Health Startup at BrainCheck in Houston, TX (remote considered)
items.content:
Company & position overview
BrainCheck is an innovative cognitive health technology company co-founded by neuroscientists Dr. David Eagleman and Dr. Yael Katz. The company recently completed its post-seed fundraising and has market traction with schools and athletic teams, physicians offices, and hospitals. The startup team is operating out of Texas Medical Center’s Innovation Center (TMCX+) in Houston.

As we scale our user-adoption and build out exciting new features in the application, we are looking for an experienced engineer to join the team and help drive product innovation. The ideal candidate is a problem-solver who can respond quickly to changing business needs. If this sounds like you and you’re excited to solve big challenges at the cutting edge of healthcare, then reach out and let’s talk.

Key responsibilities:
*Feature development and maintenance for codebases in Ruby on Rails, Unity, and Ember.
*Maintenance of the automated testing and deployment systems (Jenkins and Travis).
*BrainCheck app deployment and management on AWS.
*Integrating partner apps, such as health monitoring and EMR platforms, with BrainCheck systems.
*Comfort in a fast-paced startup environment a must

Required skills include:
*5+ years of experience working as a software developer
*Working knowledge of modern front-end development and javascript proficiency
*Test driven development procedures and tools
*Familiarity with Unity3D and/or Rails a big plus
*Use of AWS technologies, including EC2, CodeDeploy, and S3, a plus
*Experience building, deploying, and maintaining iOS and Android apps a plus

Working at BrainCheck:
*Join a vibrant team, collaborating to pioneer cognitive health
*Early-stage startup with significant upside potential
*Headquartered at TMCX+ – home to dozens of the most innovative startups and innovation labs in the healthcare industry
*We work hard but like to have fun, including happy-hours, ping-pong and other games
*Competitive compensation consisting of cash and equity

More about the Company
BrainCheck takes gold-standard neurocognitive tests and turns them into mobile interactive games, providing a snapshot of an individual’s cognitive health in about 10 minutes. Our current market offering, BrainCheck Sport, assesses cognitive deficits associated with concussion in sports and athletics, and we also have a direct to consumer version available for iPad and iPhone. Our newly released BrainCheck Memory assesses cognitive and memory impairment associated with dementia, and we are developing a generalized cognitive health tracking tool for the healthy population. BrainCheck has reinvented the process of cognitive assessment to be faster, less expensive, and as reliable as conventional methods.

BrainCheck was developed at the Eagleman Neuroscience Laboratory at Baylor College of Medicine. Dr. David Eagleman has done groundbreaking work on neurocognitive assessment, and he is also a public educator, authoring New York Times bestselling books and appearing regularly on television (most recently PBS’s series The Brain with David Eagleman). David is joined by CEO, Dr. Yael Katz, neuroscientist and technology executive, and a team of ten outstanding individuals in product, software development, clinical research, marketing, business development, and sales.

No agencies / recruiters, please

items.title: Cvedia PTE. LTD.: Generalist 3D Artist with experience in unity3d
items.content:
Generalist 3D Artist with experience in unity3d

Posted Nov 7

Cvedia PTE. LTD.
Headquarters: Spain
syncity.com

We are developing a Unity desktop application to simulate environments for autonomous vehicles. We are looking for experienced 3D Artists, we will value experience with:

  • Experience in unity3d

  • Experience editing and exporting from max or maya to unity (using fbx)

  • Experience working with unity materials and shaders

We offer:

  • Young Funded Start -Up company with Clients and endless opportunities In the most interesting and practical Industry of the Future.

  • Challenging and interesting long term project

  • Remote position

  • Full Time  position

Please mention the job title and the country you live in.

Please send your CV to: jobs@cvedia.com

Check out our projects:

https://syncity.com

https://cvedia.com

Apply for this position

Send a resume to: jobs@cvedia.com

items.title: Backend Engineer
items.content:
*** We offer flexible and full remote work over Europe.


We are not ready yet to work with people outside EU but will keep you posted on that ;) ***


Hands in hands with the Product, Design, Infrastructure and Mobile team, the Backend team has its great deal of challenges to tackle: scaling our ever growing backend business, pushing data science logics in production, shipping game changer features for our passengers and drivers with the sole goal of creating the most respectful and playful experience for them, across many launched cities, and many to come.



We expect the marketplace we are building to scale so it can support our European expansion ambitions. Fortunately, we can rely on our solid micro-services architecture (Golang, Elixir, Docker…) and our talented team to make it better.


Welcome behind the scenes !



OUR ENGINEERING VALUES



  • Move smart: we are data driven, and employ tools and best practices to ship code quickly and safely (continuous integration, code review, automated testing, etc).

  • Distribute knowledge: we want to scale our engineering team to a point where our contributions do not stop at the company code base. We believe in the Open Source culture and communication with the outside world.

  • Leave code better than you found it: because we constantly raise the bar.

  • Unity makes strength: moving people from A to B is not as easy as it sounds but, we always keep calm and support each other.

  • Always improve: we value personal progress and want you to look back proudly on what you’ve done.



WHAT YOU’LL DO



  • Implement smart models to predict future supply and demand

  • Aggregate and play with data coming from various sources

  • Work on new features in microservices environment and contribute to the improvement and optimization of our architecture

  • Optimize our operational platform to make our support even more awesome.


 Things we’d like to experiment with:



  • Event sourcing

  • Kafka…


If your are more an infractructure person wanting to deliver happiness to our backend team by building tools and frameworks please check out our Infrastructure Engineer job offer.





REQUIREMENTS



  • 5+ years as a software engineer, mainly focused on backend.

  • You are a product oriented developer, you own, design and implement features from A to Z, you help monitor and maintain them after they are shipped with focus on the end.

  • You have analytical and diagnostic skills, a proactive problem solving mindset.

  • You’ve worked with Ruby-on-Rails or Go in production environments, experience in Elixir would be great…

  • … but more than mastering 1 single language, you’re curious and a fast learner, you showed your ability to switch to another technology just to get out of your comfort zone.

  • Experience working with high volumes, databases, relational (PostgreSQL) or NoSQL.

  • Exposure to architectural patterns of a large, high-scale web application and microservices.

  • Good testing skills.

  • Sharing is caring, you are generous in your communication and knowledge sharing with your team.


BONUS POINTS



  • Contributions to open source projects

  • Experience with message brokers (such as Kafka, RabbitMQ)

  • Exposure to real-time technology problems

  • Experience with ETL and Hadoop

  • Experience with Docker and/or Mesos Marathon (or similar)



PERKS



  • Permanent contract (CDI) 

  • Stock

  • Paid conference attendance/travel and periodic team meetups

  • Heetch credits

  • A Spotify subscription

  • Work from anywhere you want

items.title: Backend Engineer (Golang / Elixir) at Heetch (Paris, France) (allows remote)
items.content:
About this job

Job type: Permanent
Experience level: Senior
Role: Backend Developer
Industry: Carsharing, Marketplace, Transportation
Company size: 51-200 people
Company type: Private

Job description

*** We offer flexible and full remote work over Europe.

We are not ready yet to work with people outside EU but will keep you posted on that ;) ***

Hands in hands with the Product, Design, Infrastructure and Mobile team, the Backend team has its great deal of challenges to tackle: scaling our ever growing backend business, pushing data science logics in production, shipping game changer features for our passengers and drivers with the sole goal of creating the most respectful and playful experience for them, across many launched cities, and many to come.


We expect the marketplace we are building to scale so it can support our European expansion ambitions. Fortunately, we can rely on our solid micro-services architecture (Golang, Elixir, Docker…) and our talented team to make it better.

Welcome behind the scenes !

OUR ENGINEERING VALUES

  • Move smart: we are data driven, and employ tools and best practices to ship code quickly and safely (continuous integration, code review, automated testing, etc).
  • Distribute knowledge: we want to scale our engineering team to a point where our contributions do not stop at the company code base. We believe in the Open Source culture and communication with the outside world.
  • Leave code better than you found it: because we constantly raise the bar.
  • Unity makes strength: moving people from A to B is not as easy as it sounds but, we always keep calm and support each other.
  • Always improve: we value personal progress and want you to look back proudly on what you’ve done.

WHAT YOU’LL DO

  • Implement smart models to predict future supply and demand
  • Aggregate and play with data coming from various sources
  • Work on new features in microservices environment and contribute to the improvement and optimization of our architecture
  • Optimize our operational platform to make our support even more awesome.

 Things we’d like to experiment with:

  • Event sourcing
  • Kafka…

If your are more an infractructure person wanting to deliver happiness to our backend team by building tools and frameworks please check out our Infrastructure Engineer job offer.

REQUIREMENTS

  • 5+ years as a software engineer, mainly focused on backend.
  • You are a product oriented developer, you own, design and implement features from A to Z, you help monitor and maintain them after they are shipped with focus on the end.
  • You have analytical and diagnostic skills, a proactive problem solving mindset.
  • You’ve worked with Ruby-on-Rails or Go in production environments, experience in Elixir would be great…
  • … but more than mastering 1 single language, you’re curious and a fast learner, you showed your ability to switch to another technology just to get out of your comfort zone.
  • Experience working with high volumes, databases, relational (PostgreSQL) or NoSQL.
  • Exposure to architectural patterns of a large, high-scale web application and microservices.
  • Good testing skills.
  • Sharing is caring, you are generous in your communication and knowledge sharing with your team.

BONUS POINTS

  • Contributions to open source projects
  • Experience with message brokers (such as Kafka, RabbitMQ)
  • Exposure to real-time technology problems
  • Experience with ETL and Hadoop
  • Experience with Docker and/or Mesos Marathon (or similar)

PERKS

  • Permanent contract (CDI) 
  • Stock
  • Paid conference attendance/travel and periodic team meetups
  • Heetch credits
  • A Spotify subscription
  • Work from anywhere you want

Benefits

Full remote (in Europe only) and flexible ways of working
Paid conferences attendance/travel
Periodic team meetups
Stocks
Heetch credits
